RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 11300. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONLY GET'N BETTER saved ground racing well off the early pace, started a bid past the seven sixteenths pole and improved steadily, raced at the rail on the far turn, took over mid-stretch and edged clear late yards. GLOBALIZATION settled off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead two deep midway on the far turn, dueled clear of A THOUSAND IDOLS mid-stretch but was outfinished the final sixteenth. The latter rated a slim lead, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and entered the far turn with the advantage, was met at the rail midway through the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. SOLOMON'S CHOICE raced well off the early pace, started a three wide bid nearing the three eighths pole but flattened in the four path on the far turn. MORNING ARTIE stalked the early pace inside then gave way leaving the second turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Only Get'n Better
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 7/16,rail turn,up 1/16,edged clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Solomon's Choice
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,off rail,3wd bid near 1/4,flattened 4p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 2 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBASLILBALLERINA took an immediate lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and held well while kept alert through the lane. JUMPIN JACK BRASS stalked the early pace three wide, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and finished well to clear second inside the eighth pole. LUCKY BOP raced off the rail into the first turn, gave chase leaving the nine sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and came along to take third later yards. SPARKLEINYOUREYE stalked off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then flattened in the lane. IHEARTRAINACOMN saved ground off the early pace and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 9/16,3p far turn,along 3rd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: XTENDED STREAK drew off to a long early lead, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled to hold onto a steadily diminishing lead. MISS ARGENTINA chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and finished well. GHOST OF ALCINA gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and finished well. LIL SPITTIN IMAGE came away slowly, picked up the chase toward the inside and showed little in the stretch. VERITAS LUX MEA came away slowly and dropped well back early. CANDY LOVES HONEY attempted to lug in through the backstretch, was taken up leaving the five sixteenths pole, returned lame and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Xtended Streak
ENTRY.COMMENT: drew off early,rail turn,steadily handled lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 2 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,0 00 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHANGE YOUR LUCK rated a short lead inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on well. BOSS E BOOGS stalked from the three path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn but had to settle for second best. MINISTRY OF MAGIC saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn, eased outward toward the head of the lane and came along for third approaching mid-stretch. PENGUIN PARADE raced hemmed at the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. MYSTIC O'SHAUNESIE stalked the early pace two deep while between horses, appeared to not make a move through the backstretch and faded in the four path into the far turn. SPANGLISH settled close to the early pace in the two and three paths, left the first turn outside, showed little response through the backstretch and rounded the far turn about the three path.

ENTRY.NAME: Penguin Parade
ENTRY.COMMENT: boxed rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,flattened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Change Your Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,rail far turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIVERVIEW STEVIE took over approaching the three quarter pole and rated the pace inside, came under pressure past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, drifted leaving the turn but dug in determinedly to hold off the stretch challenge of THE MONEY MACHINE, who was rated close off the rail and gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn just off the rail and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. DASHING LASS veered inward at the break and made contact with Embraceable then settled off the rail, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. NINETY PROOF stalked the early pace from the three path, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. NELLY TOO was jostled leaving the gate and raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. EMBRACEABLE was bumped inward and into Scarlett Strong leaving the gate, raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the half mile pole then weakened in the three path on the far turn. DEAREST M. A. came out and made contact with Nelly Too leaving the gate then saved ground and never factored. SCARLETT STRONG was jostled leaving the gate, raced in the four path on the first turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Nelly Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,rail far turn,flatten

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 2, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since March 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allo wed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PYEONG CHANG settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced close near the rail on the far turn, eased outward entering the stretch, dug in for the lead a sixteenth away and drew clear later yards. ADVANCE CASH stalked the early pace three wide then took the lead into the backstretch, was forced into a duel leaving the seven sixteenths pole and cleared Tringale past the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn but was caught flattening stride mid-stretch. TOUGH TO TAME raced well off the pace and off the rail on the first turn, bid toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn two deep and dueled through the stretch for third. WE B SHACKIN saved ground well off the early pace, picked up the chase toward the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. SCOTTSDALE rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened stride. MUCHACHO MACHO settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. TRINGALE took a brief early lead but was met into the backstretch, gave chase from that point, dropped back past the five sixteenths pole and gave way on the far turn. PRINCE OF FENTON stalked the early pace four wide, left the first turn outside and gave chase from the three eighths pole, but weakened in the six path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Muchacho Macho
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Scottsdale
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Tringale
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead,met 1/2,chased,gave way far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 2 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 2 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGGIE'S GIRL became a bit anxious in the gate then showed the way under a firm early hold, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, contested the advantage nearest the rail on the far turn and was kept sharp through the lane. JUBA BABY saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in range of the lead in the three path on the far turn then dueled to clear second the final yards. AIM'S JUBILEE stalked from the three and four paths early on, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and dug in to take third the final stride. MUSIC LASS stalked two deep, challenged toward the three eighths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, but flattened inside the eighth pole. MISS LAUREN saved ground early then angled out into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened stride at the rail on the far turn. BREADMAN'S ROSEBUD rounded the opening turn in the four path then angled out into the backstretch, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Baby
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Maggie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious gate,firmly rated,pressured 3/8,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Lauren
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved early ground,outside 1/2,chased 3/8,flattened rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 2, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THUNDERTURTLE saved ground, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then eased out to come between horses mid-stretch, took the lead in later yards and ran clear toward the wire. CICI UNIFIED settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, dug in to take second later yards but was outfinished for the win. FLAT DISCOUNT stalked the early pace two deep, took the lead past the half mile pole and drew clear toward the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but was caught in later yards. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the five path on the far turn, though, flattened stride mid-stretch. SOCIAL EXCLUSION set the early pace inside, was met past the half mile pole and gave chase from that point but dropped back approaching the five sixteenths and faded off the rail on the far turn. HIDDEN IDENTITY steadied into the first turn and made only a mild middle move on the backstretch. ONEPRETTYTHING saved ground on the opening turn, left the turn outside and never factored. WEST VIRGINIA PAM raced in the five path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Social Exclusion
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met past 1/2,chased,faded off rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderturtle
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 3/8,rail far turn,between 1/16,clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Cici Unified
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,up 2nd late,outfinishd
